Posts.Content: Oct 25, 2017 01:25PM Carly597 wrote: Thanks I've been told I will get my results by post but I am hoping to go to the clinic tomorrow to have a check up cause I still seem to have the lump the nurse said that it's really normal as it's fluid filling the gap but wants me to go in and have it drained so I will be asking if they have came back yet Many thanks for your help x
Posts.Title: Waiting for results of my lunpectomy Carly597 Carly597

Posts.Content: Carly597 wrote: hi there So last thursday I had a lumpectomy to remove a 5cm tumor and now waiting for the lab results to come back which is the stressful part, the surgeon who performed the op was amazing she said she is pretty sure it's a phyloides tumor and if that's the case I will have to return for annual checks for at least 2 years to make sure It hasn't returned, how long will I have to wait for these resilts? Will my follow ups be with her? I have seen 3 different people before the op but as she performed It will I see her again? She was so lovely I don't think I want to see anyone else, and also all the info I have seen online says phyloides tumors only really happen in women over 40 I'm only 31 is this not normal? Sorry for all the questions I'm just going out of my head with worry ad I don't even know if it's benign yet xxx Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Waiting for results of my lunpectomy Carly597 Carly597

Posts.Content: Oct 25, 2017 02:47PM Carly597 wrote: thank you I'm so glad I found this group it'd such a great help I tried yahoo answer's but get accused of lying or being a hypercondriac and worse, I was really scared as it'd in the same position and feels the same I was thinking oh my God they have left it in and more surgery etc, I'm gonna get it double checked just to put my mind at ease but a lot of people has said the same as u so I'm not so worried any more  Thank you so much for taking the time to reply to me means such a lot having all this worry at the moment xxx
